definition: exterior surface/family relationship via females/to show (one's opinion)/a model/a table (listing information)/a form/a meter (measuring sth)
dew/syrup/nectar/outdoors (not under cover)/to show/to reveal/to betray/to expose
to show in full light/to be revealed in its entirety

sentences.english: The exchange of words between the man and woman shows a lot about them.
sentences.chinese: 这位女士和这位男士间的对话表露出许多信息。

sentences.english: The atmosphere on an inpatient ward is tense because of this exerted energy.
sentences.chinese: 由于这种表露的干劲，住院病房的氛围很紧张。

sentences.english: And yet, things may be even worse than the consumer price index suggests.
sentences.chinese: 但是实际情况可能比消费价格指数所表露的更糟糕。

sentences.english: The final implied effusion is like a last judgment.
sentences.chinese: 最后含蓄的表露像是最后判决。

sentences.english: His life instinct of insistence and nature is revealed invariably in his poetry.
sentences.chinese: 在他的诗文中，无处不表露出他任真自然的本性。

sentences.english: Male users are more likely to self-disclose than female.
sentences.chinese: 调查发现，男性用户自我表露程度显著高于女性。

sentences.english: Jewelry blue with green border shows men's fashion verve.
sentences.chinese: 宝蓝色衫身绿边相衬，表露出男士时装的神韵。

sentences.english: Cheng bite gold smell speech secretly urged QinQiong show identity.
sentences.chinese: 程咬金闻言暗中催促秦琼表露身份。

sentences.english: His evil intentions were manifest and yet we could not stop him.
sentences.chinese: 译他的险恶用心表露无遗，但是我们却没办法阻止他。

sentences.english: After Japan enkindled flames of war on January 28th in Shanghai, this inclination was shown more distinctively.
sentences.chinese: 一二八战火点燃后，这种倾向更鲜明地表露出来。

sentences.english: But I now suspect that Dr. Liew was just showing a common human frailty.
sentences.chinese: 但我怀疑刘博士只是表露了人类常见的脆弱性格。

sentences.english: Once these feelings have been externalized, client and the therapist are able to explore the issues that have surfaced .
sentences.chinese: 一旦这些情感表露出来，患者便能够探讨有关问题。

sentences.english: JANG Hyuk is basking in happiness and it shows.
sentences.chinese: 张赫正沉浸在幸福中，这一点现在已表露无遗。

sentences.english: Why he didn't even show any gratitude!
sentences.chinese: 为什么他甚至一点也没有表露出感谢之意。

sentences.english: The 30-foot rule also applies to affection.
sentences.chinese: 这个30英尺惯例也适用于表露对孩子的喜爱之情。

sentences.english: He unlocked the secrets of his heart.
sentences.chinese: 他表露了他心中的秘密。

definition: to reveal (indirectly, implicitly)/to show (interest, contempt etc) by means of one's actions, tone of voice etc
to cover up/to conceal/to mask/to gloss over
to show in full light/to be revealed in its entirety
to be secretive; to try to cover up (idiom)
to conceal/to hide (a taboo subject)/to cover up the truth
to hold back from saying precisely what is on one's mind
to try to cover up/hiding place
